title: Cusumano 2016 Alta Mora Bianco  (Etna)
description: Subdued aromas suggest Spanish broom and chamomile flower. Reflecting the nose, the lean, linear palate is also restrained, offering citrus, lemon zest and a hint of beeswax.

title: Delibori 2015  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso
description: Aromas of tilled soil and black plum lead into the straightforward palate along with prune, bitter almond and a note of baking spice. Round tannins offer support. Drink through 2019.

title: Ca' Momi 2016 Bianco White (California)
description: Savory earthy accents complement ripe melon flavors and a generous texture in this pale-colored, medium-bodied wine. It has good heft on the palate, and is rich enough to keep the flavors lingering.

title: Ca' Rugate 2016 Rio Albo  (Valpolicella)
description: This has delicate aromas of baking spice and red-skinned berry. Mirroring the nose, the no-frills, enjoyable palate offers red plum, vanilla and a hint of white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Domìni Veneti 2015  Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso
description: Delicate aromas of baking spice and black-skinned berry emerge in the glass. On the straightforward palate, notes of vanilla and star anise back up black-cherry jam. Round tannins offer easygoing support. Drink soon.

title: Durigutti 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Basic wood smoke, plum and berry aromas are solid enough to mask some of this Cabernet's greener components. Its dense palate is pillowy, tasting of herbal blackberry and spice cake. Leafy berry notes and a touch of chocolate mark the finish.

title: Edetària 2016 Viaterra Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Aromas of orange peel and tarragon are spunky and a little green on the nose. This fresh, lean Garnacha Blanca shows moderate acidity and short flavors of green melon and almond skins. A bit of saltiness is present on a dry finish.

title: Funckenhausen 2016 Red (Mendoza)
description: This blend of Malbec, Bonarda and Syrah offers earth, leather, latex and berry fruit aromas that are mildly aggressive. In the mouth, generic berry flavors come with a hint of herbal green on the finish.

title: Goodfellow 2015 Whistling Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This wine's extremely tart berry fruit seems barely ripe, hinting at wild raspberries. It's a high-acid, stiff and herbal style, which seems to be intentional, as it was made with 50% whole clusters.

title: Goodfellow 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: From vines a quarter century old, this distinctive offering features fresh Mediterranean herb, apple and pear skin notes and a core of white peach, apple and jicama. Don't look for ripe fruit; the style here emphasizes subtle texture and herbal characteristics.

title: Iris Vineyards 2015 Aroha Vineyard Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: You may find tasters divided on this wine; for some it will be delicious, for others overripe and alcoholic. It's definitely big in style, with quite ripe, almost raisiny fruit flavors, a hint of plastic on the nose and astringent tannins.

title: Kaiken 2016 Ultra Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Heavy oak and related char, chocolate and mocha aromas make up the nose of this dark, grippy Cabernet Sauvignon. There's plenty of oak flavor, along with herbal berry notes, but it finishes raw, tannic and scratchy, with a hard texture.

title: La Honda Winery 2013 Lonehawk Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Rich blackberry and candied black-cherry aromas meet with strong cedar, roast beef, smoke, olive, soy and a tarry quality on the nose of this bottling. It's very dry and sticky with tannins on the sip, which relegate the flavors of red cherry and roasting herbs to the background. The 100% American oak treatment remains prominent, so this may evolve more favorably with time.

title: Love That Red 2015 Fillies & Mares Riviere Galets Vineyard Grenache
description: The aromas in this wine aren't entirely harmonious, with high-toned herb, spice and mineral notes. The palate, however, brings plenty of intrigue, with velvety-soft, mouth-coating red fruit flavors and savory herbal hints that linger on the finish. Unfortunately, the two don't sync up.

title: Mad Fish 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Western Australia)
description: The Sémillon really takes the fore in this SBS blend. Wet wool, bruised citrus fruit and white pepper lead into a restrained, almost austere palate. The acidity is in check but the fruit is lacking. It all ends with an intriguing salty, copper-penny finish.

title: Maison Deux-Fleurs 2016  Mâcon-Villages
description: This floral, aromatic wine is light, bright and enticingly fruity. Its light acidity and crisp, brisk texture are all attractive parts of a wine that is already very drinkable.

title: Markham 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Florally perfumed in orange blossom, this plush, medium-bodied white is awash in pineapple and a strong taste of cinnamon stick, its oak pronounced and supportive.

title: Mocén 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: Varietally familiar aromas of snappy citrus fruits are feline in nature. This is light in body, refreshing and citric. Flavors of lime and tangerine are stony and show a hint of green herbs, while this is lasting on a fresh finish.

title: Monte Tondo 2015 Campo Grande  (Valpolicella Ripasso)
description: Black cherry, tobacco and baking-spice aromas lead the nose while the soft, ripe palate shows prune and white-pepper accents. Pliant tannins give it an easygoing nature. Drink soon.

title: Oregon Territory 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This clean and simple wine is a textbook example of Oregon Pinot Gris. Its lightly spiced pear and apple fruit is fresh and varietally correct, making for a pleasant sipper.

title: Penner-Ash 2015 Syrah (Oregon)
description: This is a wide open, fruity wine, with upfront berry and citrus notes backed by chalky acids. It's a good, quaffable red but lacks the complex meat and compost notes often found in Northwest Syrahs.

title: Prosper Maufoux 2016  Bourgogne
description: This long-established negociant house, based in Santenay, has made a generous, ripe white Burgundy. It is soft and smooth, with ripe red apple and quince fruit. Drink the wine now.

title: Reustle 2016 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)
description: This was harvested at low brix and fermented principally in French oak. It's a soft, floral take on Viognier, with scents and flavors that suggest baby powder. Because of its Meyer lemon and other candied citrus notes, odds are either a small amount of Gewürztraminer was blended in or some residual sugar remains, though neither is indicated. Drink now and over the next two to three years.

title: Rutini 2014 Encuentro Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This leads with flat, earthy raisin and prune aromas. The palate is bulky, thick and syrupy, with stewy cassis and berry flavors laced with coconutty oak. It's dense and slightly overdone on the finish.

title: Silvan Ridge 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is stiffly tannic, with red plum and spicy cherry fruit. It's a hard, chewy wine that could use some time to soften, but its rusticity is undeniably flavorful. Pair it with hearty winter stews or coq au vin.

title: Smith & Perry 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This new entry in the budget Pinot Noir market is perfectly fine, if ordinary. It offers tart berry, pomegranate and light herbal highlights. The tannins are proportionate, and everything is in balance. A fair wine at a fair price.

title: Thierry et Pascale Matrot 2016  Bourgogne
description: This wine comes from just outside Meursault, giving both richness and juicy fruitiness. Apricots and ripe melon add to tastes of citrus and crisp apple to offer a wine that is fruity, soft, lightly buttery and ready to drink.

title: Titus 2013 Andronicus Red (Napa Valley)
description: Largely tannic and generous in oak, this is a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon and Zinfandel. Plum, currant, bread dough and leather are among the more powerful components, with a rich rounded mouthfeel providing approachability.

title: Viña Cobos 2016 Felino Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This wine's plum and currant aromas are raw and wild, with a hint of animal and not a lot of overt ripeness. It's medium bodied and rubbery in mouthfeel, with a mix of salty and woody flavors and moderately ripe plum notes. On the finish, it tastes mostly of spicy oak and mint.

title: Vincent Girardin 2015 Cuvée Saint-Vincent  (Bourgogne)
description: Girardin, based in Meursault, has made a ripe, fruity red Burgundy that reflects the generous red fruits of the vintage. It is juicy, soft and rounded, with attractive acidity and light tannins. Drink now.
